column4: No sound at all with an NVidia card on Ubuntu 8.04. Detecing the driver and nothing happens, I re-installed and stills the same...
better to buy a cheap ati card:) instead of being tortured again and again
I know I will find a solution soon.
I got tortured by both nvidia and ati, now, I'm glad, I ended up with ati
Can I get it via Synaptics?
-nv is the an open source driver for nvidia
I guess it's installed already, probably the one running, find out in /var/log/Xorg.0.log
I used Envy-NG to install it
sound is easier than video, do you have something in cat /proc/asound/cards

1) run alsaconf as root 2) add yourself to the 'audio' group (log out and log in again) 3) use alsamixer and unmute channels and raise levels (also try muting some channels) 4) arts or esound stopped? 5) OSS modules unloaded? 6) speakers on? 7) modprobe snd-pcm-oss  8) does "aplay /usr/share/sounds/alsa/Noise.wav" work for root? Test your sound with aplay and a wav so codec issues don't confuse the situation. <list alsa us
it's easier, if the driver is up
